intro: Miconia tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of the Guyanas and northern South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, violet-pink bracts that surround its small flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations above 1,000 meters. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species, and it is also of interest for its potential medicinal properties.
